  3. Ben Starav

Ben Starav

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Ben Starav is an imposing mountain which rears up steeply from the head of Loch Etive. Higher up it has some fine ridges and is a great viewpoint.

 You have not climbed Ben Starav.

Region: Fort William

Altitude: 1078 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 4.25/5
Rating: 4.2/5 (89 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Ben Starav and Glas Bheinn Mhor from Glen Etive

Other routes and challenges

Ben Starav is a tough ascent by any standards, but the route above can be extended by the very fit.

You could optionally include Beinn nan Aighenan as a detour, and after Glas Bheinn Mhor to take in Stob Coire an Albannaich and Meall nan Eun - doing all five would be a huge challenge.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Glencoe Hotels

Glencoe B&B

Glencoe Cottages

Lochaber Hostels
